p: Figure 4 clearly shows the dramatic difference between what could have been (under natural forcing only) and the impact of human activities to date (assuming that no significant human interventions, positive or negative, will take place during the remainder of the 21 st century). The percentage reduction of fluvial sediment supply to the coast due to human impacts from 1954 to 2013 is 71%, as shown in Fig. 4. The projected CC driven increase in riverflow during the 21 st century will only compensate for 1% of this deficit by 2100.
